interaction_summary:
=== Purchase Information ===
Product Title: The Middle: Season 4
Review Date: 2016/06/02
Store: Patricia Heaton  (Actor),     Neil Flynn  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Categories: Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
Product Description: ['The Middle: The Complete Fourth Season', 'Patricia Heaton, Neil Flynn, Charlie McDermott, Eden Sher and Atticus Shaffer star as the middle class, middle of the country (i.e. Orson, Indiana) Heck family in this warm and witty comedy about raising a family and lowering your expectations. While Frankie continues to struggle selling cars at the only remaining car dealer in town, an unexpected turn of events might force her to reevaluate her career path. Axl’s slothlike days are numbered, now that Mike’s made it his mission to ensure that his oldest son somehow earns a sports scholarship and goes to college next year. Meanwhile, Sue’s not only navigating high school, but wants to navigate Indiana roads – by getting her driver’s license. It’s no wonder that youngest son Brick keeps his nose in a book!', ']]>']
Average Rating: 4.9
Product Details: {'Genre': 'Kids & Family, Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Full Screen', 'Contributor': 'Patricia Heaton, Charlie McDermott, Eden Sher, Eileen Heisler, Neil Flynn, Atticus Shaffer, DeAnn HelinePatricia Heaton, Charlie McDermott, Eden Sher, Eileen Heisler, Neil Flynn, Atticus Shaffer, DeAnn Heline   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '3', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 2.88 Ounces', 'Item model number': '883929373925', 'Media Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, NTSC, Widescreen, Full Screen', 'Run time': '8 hours and 32 minutes', 'Release date': 'February 25, 2014', 'Actors': 'Patricia Heaton, Neil Flynn, Charlie McDermott, Eden Sher, Atticus Shaffer', 'Subtitles': 'Spanish, French, English', 'Producers': 'DeAnn Heline, Eileen Heisler', 'Studio': 'Studio Distribution Services', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '3'}
Review Text: Either you like this show, or you hate it.  I like it a lot.  Laugh out loud several time every episode.  Video and audio quality is excellent.
Review Title: Funny, Funny, Funny
Rating: 5.0

reference_summary:
Don't Go Near The Water (Remastered)
Charles Walters  (Director),     Glenn Ford  (Actor),     Gia Scala  (Actor)    &                   0                  more   Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
["They also serve who only sit and type! Hollywood brought audiences to atten-hut! in the 1950s and '60s with a string of military comedies like Mr. Roberts, Operation Petticoat, Ensign Pulver, No Time for Sergeants and this splash into the typing pool of dry-land sailors -- a Navy publicity team in the World War II Pacific. Glenn Ford, who appeared in a fistful of the era's service comedies, stars as a lieutenant with a knack for PR activities like placating big shots, calming romantic waters, deflating puffed-up journalists and puffing a profane-mouthed gob into the public's idea of the perfect enlisted man. Also in the large, shipshape cast: Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn and Mickey Shaughnessy."]
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Contributor': 'Glenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ TamblynGlenn Ford, Eva Gabor, Anne Francis, Charles Walters, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Keenan Wynn, Jeff Richards, Fred Clark, Russ Tamblyn   See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Runtime': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '7.5 x 5.5 x 0.5 inches; 2.12 Ounces', 'Director': 'Charles Walters', 'Media Format': 'NTSC, Original recording remastered', 'Run time': '1 hour and 47 minutes', 'Release date': 'August 1, 2011', 'Actors': 'Glenn Ford, Gia Scala, Earl Holliman, Anne Francis, Keenan Wynn', 'Studio': 'MGM', 'Country of Origin': 'USA', 'Number of discs': '1'}
This has always been one of my favorite movies. I was so happy to see it finally release on DVD.  However, Warner Brothers could have done a much better job on the DVD.  It is shown in a 2.35:1 widescreen format.  I believe that Amazon said 1.78:1, which is incorrect.  The case says remastered, but I found the quality of the picture way below what it should be.  The picture is grainy and the sound is only so-so.  For the price, I was expecting better.  There are NO SUBTITLES.  You would think if it was "remastered" they could at least add that feature.  Having said all this, the movie is still a hoot.  Glad to add it to my dvd collection.  They just don't make them this entertaining anymore.
WB could have done better!
WKRP in Cincinnati: The Complete Series [DVD]
Howard Hesseman  (Actor),     Frank Bonner  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Genre for Featured Categories, Comedy
['Product Description', "Pairing an impeccable ensemble cast with hilarious wit and popular tunes, WKRP in Cincinnati celebrated four amazing seasons, making it the quintessential situation comedy for any music lover! Join everyone's favorite radio DJs—the rockin' Dr. Johnny Fever (Howard Hesseman) and the soulful Venus Flytrap (Tim Reid)—as they weave through the inner-office antics of the crazy WKRP staff including the station's steady program director Andy (Gary Sandy), indecisive manager Carlson (Gordon Jump), smarmy advertising executive Herb (Frank Bonner), quirky news man Les Nessman (Richard Sanders), shy ingénue Bailey (Jan Smithers) and, of course, the station's lovely receptionist, Jennifer (Loni Anderson). So sit back and enjoy the sound of uproarious laughter as you watch all 90 episodes of this iconic series!", 'Bonus Content:', 'Disc 13:', 'WKRP in Cincinnati: A Paley Center Reunion', 'WKRP in Cincinnati: A Paley Center Reunion', '"Do My Eyes Say Yes?" Featurette', '"Do My Eyes Say Yes?" Featurette', '"A \'Fish Story\' Story" Featurette', '"A \'Fish Story\' Story" Featurette', 'A Conversation with Gary Sandy', 'A Conversation with Gary Sandy', ']]>', 'Review', 'Shout! Factory has done yeoman’s work in trying to correct this with', 'WKRP in Cincinnati: The Complete Series', '...The image quality, considering this series was originally shot on video tape, is almost uniformly outstanding. And, once again, Andy is overseeing a station playing the likes of Bruce Springsteen, the Rolling Stones, AC/DC, the Grateful Dead, Tom Petty, Elvis Costello, the Cars, Wings and the Police, instead of a series of featureless Muzak tracks.  Nick DeRiso -Nick DeRisosomethingelsereviews.com']
{'Genre': 'Comedy/Television, Television', 'Format': 'DVD', 'Contributor': 'Richard Sanders, Loni Anderson, Frank Bonner, Howard Hesseman, Gordon Jump, Hugh Wilson, Gary Sandy, Jan Smithers, Tim ReidRichard Sanders, Loni Anderson, Frank Bonner, Howard Hesseman, Gordon Jump, Hugh Wilson, Gary Sandy, Jan Smithers, Tim Reid  See more', 'Language': 'English', 'Number Of Discs': '12', 'Aspect Ratio': '1.33:1', 'Is Discontinued By Manufacturer': 'No', 'MPAA rating': 'NR (Not Rated)', 'Product Dimensions': '0.7 x 7.5 x 5.4 inches; 1.45 Pounds', 'Item model number': 'generic', 'Media Format': 'DVD', 'Run time': '37 hours and 30 minutes', 'Release date': 'April 17, 2018', 'Actors': 'Howard Hesseman, Frank Bonner, Gary Sandy, Tim Reid, Richard Sanders', 'Subtitles': 'Afrikaans', 'Studio': 'SHOUT! FACTORY', 'Number of discs': '12'}
This was a great series for sure and the music is important to me.  However, I also want a great picture.  Too many of the Shout Factory TV series releases video and sound quality have been poor.  I just watched a video teaser on the Shout website and if this is the same quality as the actual release, we are all in for a real treat.  This looks so much better than the original TV broadcasts.  Can't wait to see this.....
Music important, but so is picture quality
Big Bang Theory: Season 8
Johnny Galecki  (Actor),     Jim Parsons  (Actor)    Rated:    NR    Format: DVD
Movies & TV, Featured Categories, DVD, Comedy
{'Genre': 'Comedy', 'Format': 'Multiple Formats, Box set, Color, Dolby, NTSC, Subtitled', 'Contributor': 'Mayim Bialik, Melissa Rauch, Steven Molaro, Bill Prady, Jim Parsons, Kunal Nayyar, Simon Helberg, Chuck Lorre, Johnny Galecki, Kaley CuocoMayim Bialik, Melissa Rauch, Steven Molaro, Bill Prady, Jim Parsons, Kunal Nayyar, Simon Helberg, Chuck Lorre, Johnny Galecki, Kaley Cuoco   See more', 'Initial release date': '2015-09-15', 'Language': 'English'}
What can I say?  This is my favorite show.  Picture quality is excellent.  Nice not to have to look at station logos, pop-ups and commercials as when originally aired.  Looking forward to buying season 9.
My favorite show!

profile:
**User Profile Summary:**

- **Primary Interest:** Classic Comedy Films and Television, with a growing appreciation for newer sitcoms.
- **Content Preference:** Enjoys a mix of military-themed comedies from the 1950s and 1960s, alongside modern iconic sitcoms, demonstrating a broad love for varied comedic narratives across eras.
- **Format:** Prefers DVDs, especially remastered versions, signifying a commitment to quality and nostalgia in presentation.
- **Quality Expectations:** Upholds high standards for picture and sound quality and expresses disappointment with subpar releases, reflecting a consistent prioritization of technical excellence.
- **Purchase Behavior:** Actively collects favorite classic films and TV series, with tendencies towards nostalgia-driven purchasing while engaging with contemporary content.
- **Review Tendencies:** Offers balanced, thoughtful reviews highlighting both positive aspects and areas for improvement, showcasing a critical yet appreciative approach to feedback.
- **Engagement with Content:** Demonstrates a love for discussing and sharing insights on both classic and modern films and television, as evidenced by detailed reviews.

Recent interactions indicate a strong affinity for newer sitcoms, particularly appreciating humor and quality in family-centric narratives, leading to a focus on both laughter and technical details in recent reviews. Overall, the user is a dedicated film and television enthusiast who values historical significance, entertainment quality, and technical excellence across a diverse array of media.
